references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces Latent Diffusion Models (LDMs), a foundational architecture that significantly reduces computational costs for high-resolution image synthesis, enabling various applications and influencing subsequent research.

This paper introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models, a key approach in generative modeling that forms the basis for many subsequent diffusion-based models used in image generation and editing.

references.paper_title: Diffusion models beat gans on image synthesis
references.reason: This paper demonstrates that diffusion models can achieve state-of-the-art results in image synthesis, surpassing generative adversarial networks (GANs) in terms of image quality and fidelity.

references.paper_title: Demofusion: Democratising high-resolution image generation with no $$$
references.reason: This paper introduces DemoFusion, a method that democratizes high-resolution image generation without significant computational costs, which is directly compared to and improved upon in the current paper.
This paper introduces the Inception network architecture, a convolutional neural network design crucial for many image-related tasks and used as part of the metrics calculation in the current paper.
